Category: Code Tips

"Code Tips" posts discuss tips and tricks for a certain web development topic. Unlike the "Tutorials" posts which teach from the ground up, code Tips assume that the reader has a little better than basic understanding of the topics discussed.

Media Queries Are Important

CSS3 media queries can help sites perform better in Google search results and the W3C officially recommends them as a web standard. Read post »

5 Reasons Why You Need To Learn To Use JavaScript Before jQuery

A list of good reasons why it's better to learn JavaScript before jQuery. A short learning resource list at the end to help you get started. Read post »

A Simple Explanation of HTML5

A lengthy but simple explanation of what HTML5 is with suggestions on how business can use it. Very little technical language is used. Read post »

5 Mobile Web Development Best Practice Resources

Great mobile web development best practice resource list-includes site speed gurus, blogs & a podcast featuring jQuery creator, John Resig Read post »

2 Bad Things About the Facebook App Setup

Creating a Facebook app is easy but doing so generates CSS expressions and creates page reflows, all of which reduce page optimization Read post »

A great New York Times piece on HTML5 application development and a demo of their new HTML5 Skimmer site Read post »

A quick review of HTML5 Boilerplate version 1.0, discussing the new build script for site optimization and custom site template build Read post »

Walk-through of Aaron T. Grogg's excellent HTML5 Boilerplate-based WordPress theme. Includes a great admin screen for custom configuration. Read post »
